makeLuaSprite.documentation:
Spawns a Lua Sprite with no animations using the tag `tag`, it will be using the image `image`.png, and will be spawned on position `x`, `y` If you want to make a Black screen with no texture, leave `image` field empty and use (luaSpriteMakeGraphic)[]

If another Lua Sprite that exists is already using the tag `tag`, it will be removed.

makeAnimatedLuaSprite.documentation:
Spawns a Lua Sprite that supports Animations, it will be using the tag `tag`, be using the image `image`.png, the XML `image`.xml, and will be spawned on position `x`, `y`

If another Lua Sprite that exists is already using the tag `tag`, it will be removed.

addLuaSprite.documentation: Adds a Lua Sprite with the specified tag, either in front or behind the characters.

removeLuaSprite.documentation:
Removes a Lua Sprite with the specified tag
* `tag` - The Lua Sprite's tag
* `destroy` - Specifies if you don't want to use the sprite anymore. Default value is `true` (Set to `false` if you want to re-add it later)

makeLuaText.documentation: Creates a Lua Text object on position `x`, `y` and a width with 'width'

addLuaText.documentation: Spawns a Lua Text on the stage

removeLuaText.documentation:
Removes a Lua Text off the stage
* `tag` - The Lua Sprite's tag
* `destroy` - Specifies if you don't want to use the sprite anymore. Default value is `true` (Set to `false` if you want to re-add it later)

setTextString.documentation: Sets text string at the specified tag

setTextSize.documentation: Sets text size at the specified tag

setTextWidth.documentation: Sets text width at the specified tag

setTextBorder.documentation: Sets text border at the specified tag

setTextColor.documentation: Sets text color at the specified tag

setTextFont.documentation: Sets text font at the specified tag

setTextItalic.documentation: Sets text as italic or not based on the `italic` parameter

setTextAlignment.documentation: Sets text alignment at the specified tag `'left'`,`'right'`, or `'center'`

getTextString.documentation: Gets text object's text at the specified tag

getTextSize.documentation: Gets text object's size at the specified tag

getTextFont.documentation: Gets text object's font at the specified tag

getTextWidth.documentation: Gets text object's width at the specified tag

startDialogue.documentation:
Starts a dialogue loading a file inside `mods/data/your-song-name/`.
* `dialogueFile` - .TXT file to load
* `song` - Optional value for a Background music during the dialogue

Example: If i want to load a dialogue file `mods/data/bopeebo/dialogue.txt` using the pause menu song (Breakfast), i should use: `startDialogue('bopeebo/dialogue', 'breakfast')`

NOTE: When the dialogue is ended, it calls `startCountdown()`

NOTE 2: `onNextDialogue(line)` callback is called for every dialogue line passed

startVideo.documentation:
Starts a Video Cutscene
* `videoFile` - File name of your video, it must be inside `mods/videos/`

Example: If you wanted to start the video `mods/videos/ughCutscene.mp4`, you'd have to use `startVideo('ughCutscene')`

startCountdown.documentation: In case you forced a countdown stop for doing a pre-song cutscene or something, this starts the countdown again manually.

endSong.documentation: In case you forced a song end for doing a post-song cutscene or something, this ends the song manually.

characterPlayAnim.documentation:
* `character` - Can be `boyfriend`, `dad` or `gf`
*`anim` - Animation name to be played
* `forced` - Can be either `true` or `false`, if set to `true`, it will force the animation to reset if the current animation is the same as the animation to play
characterPlayAnim.deprecated: characterPlayAnim is deprecated! Use playAnim instead

characterDance.documentation:
Makes character do the idle dance
* `character` - Can be `boyfriend`, `dad` or `gf`

getCharacterX.documentation:
Gets the general X position of a character from the type `type`
* `type` - Can be `boyfriend`, `dad` or `gf`

setCharacterX.documentation:
Sets the general X position of a character from the type `type`, this will also move all precached characters from the same type into the position you want
* `type` - Can be `boyfriend`, `dad` or `gf`

getCharacterY.documentation:
Gets the general Y position of a character from the type `type`
* `type` - Can be `boyfriend`, `dad` or `gf`

setCharacterY.documentation:
Sets the general Y position of a character from the type `type`, this will also move all precached characters from the same type into the position you want
* `type` - Can be `boyfriend`, `dad` or `gf`

addScore.documentation: Adds `value` to the current song's score and recalculates rating

setScore.documentation: Set the current song's score to `value` and recalculates rating

addMisses.documentation: Adds `value` to the current song's misses total and recalculates rating

setMisses.documentation: Set the current song's misses total to `value` and recalculates rating

addHits.documentation: Adds `value` to the current song's notes hit total and recalculates rating

setHits.documentation: Set the current song's notes hit total to `value` and recalculates rating

setRatingPercent.documentation:
Sets the rating percent in case you want to do your own rating calculation.
* `value` - Should go from `0` to `1` but can actually be whatever value you want, but it's kinda stupid to get out of the base values.

setRatingString.documentation: Sets the rating name to `value` in case you want to do your own rating calculation.

keyJustPressed.documentation:
Get if the key `name` just got pressed on the current frame.

Keys: `'left'`, `'down'`, `'up'`, `'right'`, `'accept'`, `'back'`, `'pause'`, `'reset'`, `'space'`

keyPressed.documentation:
Get if the key `name` is being held on the current frame.

Keys: `'left'`, `'down'`, `'up'`, `'right'`, `'space'`

keyReleased.documentation:
Get if the key `name` was released on the current frame.

Keys: `'left'`, `'down'`, `'up'`, `'right'`, `'space'`

mouseClicked.documentation:
Get if the mouse button `name` just got pressed on the current frame. leave 'name' blank for left mouse

Buttons: `'left'`, `'right'`, `'middle'`

mousePressed.documentation:
Get if the mouse button `name` is being held on the current frame.

Buttons: `'left'`, `'right'`, `'middle'`

mouseReleased.documentation:
Get if the mouse button `name` was released on the current frame.

Buttons: `'left'`, `'right'`, `'middle'`

getMouseX.documentation:
Returns the relative mouse X position on a specific camera
* `camera` - Can be either `game`, `hud` or `other`

getMouseY.documentation:
Returns the relative mouse Y position on a specific camera
* `camera` - Can be either `game`, `hud` or `other`

triggerEvent.documentation:
Triggers an event without you having to chart them.
* `name` - Event name on Chart Editor
* `arg1` - Value 1 on Chart Editor
* `arg2` - Value 2 on Chart Editor

addLuaScript.documentation:
Loads another .lua script.
* `path` - Path to LUA relative to the base folder

getColorFromHex.documentation:
Get the color decimal ID from an Hexadecimal value (`color`).

Example: To get orange, you should use `getColorFromHex('FF7800')` or `getColorFromHex('0xFFFF7800')`

getSongPosition.documentation: Returns the current song position. Shortcut to `getPropertyClass('Conductor', 'songPosition')`

cameraShake.documentation:
* `camera` - "game","hud" or "other"
* `intensity` - How far away should it shake, recommended value is `0.05`
* `duration` - Time duration for it to shake

cameraSetTarget.documentation:
Makes the camera focus on a specific target
* `target` - Target can be either `boyfriend` or `dad`

cameraFlash.documentation:
* `camera` - "game","hud" or "other"
* `color` - color of flash
* `duration` - Time duration for it to flash
* `forced` - restarts flash or not

cameraFade.documentation:
* `camera` - "game","hud" or "other"
* `color` - color of fade
* `duration` - Time duration for it to fade
* `forced` - restarts fade or not

debugPrint.documentation:
* Prints a debug message on the top-left corner of the screen
* All values are optional
* You can have up to 5 values to be printed.

Example: `debugPrint("Current boyfriend character: ", getProperty("boyfriend.curCharacter"));`

This will print the following message: `Current boyfriend character: bf`

close.documentation:
Stops your script in the next 100 miliseconds.
* `printMessage` - Wether you want a warning to show on the top-left corner of the screen or not

makeGraphic.documentation:
Used for making an object use a solid color Width x Height frame instead of a texture.
* `obj` - Lua Sprite tag or Object variable name
* `width` - Width in pixels of the graphic you want to create
`height` - Height in pixels of the graphic you want to create
* `color` - Color string, works the same as `getColorFromHex()`

Example: Use `makeGraphic('testBlackSquare', 1000, 1000, '000000')` to make the Lua Sprite with the tag "testBlackSquare" turn into a 1000x1000 black square.

setBlendMode.documentation:
Changes the blend mode of a Sprite (Works similar to how Photoshop do it)
* `obj` - Lua Sprite tag or Object variable name
* `blend` - Blend mode to use. Example: `add`, `darken`, `normal`.

[List of blend modes](https://api.haxe.org/flash/display/BlendMode.html)

addAnimationByPrefix.args: tag:String, name:String, prefix:String, framerate:Int = 24, loop:Bool = true
addAnimationByPrefix.documentation:
Adds an animation `name` to the Lua Sprite/Object using the tag/variable `tag`, it will also overwrite another animation using the same name.
* `obj` - Lua Sprite tag or Object variable name
* `name` - Animation to be added's name
* `prefix` - Animation name on the .xml file
* `framerate` - Optional value, how many frames per second does the animation have, Default value is `24`
* `loop` - Optional value, should the animation loop? Default value: `true`

addAnimationByIndices.documentation:
Adds an animation `name` to the Lua Sprite/Object using the tag/variable `tag` with the specified indices on `indices`, it will also overwrite another animation using the same name.
* `obj` - Lua Sprite tag or Object variable name
* `name` - Animation to be added's name
* `prefix` - Animation name on the .xml file
* `indices` - What frames the animation should use, must be separated with a comma. Example: `1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 3, 4, 5`
* `framerate` - Optional value, how many frames per second does the animation have, Default value is `24`

objectPlayAnimation.documentation:
Plays animation `name` on a Lua Sprite/Object with the tag/variable `obj`.
* `obj` - Lua Sprite tag or Object variable name
* `name` - Animation name to play
* `forced` - If true, the animation will reset if the current animation is the same as the one you're trying to play. Default value is `false`
objectPlayAnimation.deprecated: objectPlayAnimation is deprecated! Use playAnim instead

getObjectOrder.documentation:
Gets the object's layer position
* `obj` - Object variable/Lua Sprite tag

setObjectOrder.documentation:
Sets the object's layer position
* `obj` - Object variable/Lua Sprite tag
* `position` - New position the object will be in

(note: when referring to characters, you must refer to their group) `boyfriendGroup`, `gfGroup`, `dadGroup`

removeFromGroup.documentation:
* `obj` - Group/Array variable
* `index` - Member ID
* `dontDestroy` - Optional variable. Won't clear member from memory, you will probably never ever use this.

Example: To remove the first spawned note from the group you should use `removeFromGroup('notes', 0)`

setGraphicSize.documentation:
* `obj` - Object from PlayState or Lua Sprite
* `multX` - Horizontal multiplier, default value is 1
* `multY` - Vertical multiplier, default value is 1

updateHitbox.documentation:
Use this to update the hitbox in case you change the sprite's scale manually or via a tween.
* `obj` - Object from PlayState or Lua Sprite

setScrollFactor.documentation:
Changes how much a Sprite moves along with the camera.
* `obj` - Lua Sprite tag or Object variable name
* `scrollX` - Horizontal movement multiplier
* `scrollY` - Vertical movement multiplier

Note: Boyfriend/Opponent have a scrollX/scrollY value of 1, while Girlfriend have a scrollX/scrollY value of 0.95, if you're gonna do background elements, it's highly suggested that you make the values something under 1.

setObjectCamera.documentation:
Changes on which camera should your object be drawn on
* `obj` - Lua Sprite tag or Object variable name
* `camera` - `game`, `hud` or `other`.

addCharacterToList.documentation:
Creates a character for the `'Change Character'` event.
* `name` - Character name, example: `pico-player`, `mom-car`, `gf`, etc.
* `type` - Character type, 'boyfriend' for player, 'dad' for opponent, 'gf' for girlfriend.

precacheSound.documentation: * `name` - Asset name, should be located inside `mods/sounds/` or `assets/sounds/`

precacheImage.documentation:
* `name` - Asset name, should be located inside `mods/images/`

NOTE: For now precacheImage is only capable of precaching images inside `mods/`!

playMusic.documentation:
* `sound` - File name (Should be located in `mods/music/` or `assets/music/`)
* `volume` - Optional value, volume percent goes from `0` to `1`. Default value: `1`
* `volume` - Optional value, if the music should loop indefinitely. Default value: `false`

playSound.documentation:
* `sound` - File name (Should be located in `mods/sounds/` or `assets/sounds/`)
* `volume` - Optional value, volume percent goes from `0` to `1`. Default value: `1`
* OPTIONAL: `tag` - Should only be used if you want to pause, resume, change the time, volume or fade in/out your sound, if you don't want to use it, don't include a third value.

stopSound.documentation:
This function will stop the sound AND remove it permanently!
* `tag` - Sound tag

soundFadeIn.documentation:
* `tag` - Sound tag, leave this field empty if you want to do a fade in on the Background music instead
`duration` - The time it takes for the volume to go from `fromValue` to `toValue`
* `fromValue` - Starting value. Default value is `0`
* `toValue` - End value. Default value is `1`

soundFadeOut.documentation:
* `tag` - Sound tag, leave this field empty if you want to do a fade out on the Background music instead
* `duration` - The time it takes for the volume to go from the starting volume to `toValue`
* `toValue` - End value. Default value is `0`

soundFadeCancel.documentation: * `tag` - Sound tag, leave this field empty if you want cancel the Background music's fade in/out instead

getSoundVolume.documentation: * `tag` - Sound tag, leave this field empty if you want get the Background music's volume instead

setSoundVolume.documentation:
* `tag` - Sound tag, leave this field empty if you want change the Background music's volume instead
* `value` - Goes from `0` to `1`.

getSoundTime.documentation:
Gets the current sound's position in miliseconds
* `tag` - Sound tag

setSoundTime.documentation:
Sets the current sound's position in miliseconds
* `tag` - Sound tag
* `value` - New position

noteTweenX.documentation:
Do a tween on a receptor's X position
* `tag` - Once the tween is finished, it will do a callback of `onTweenCompleted(tag)`
* `note` - Opponent's notes are 0, 1, 2 and 3, respectively. Boyfriend's notes are 4, 5, 6, 7 respectively.
* `value` - Target value on the tween end
* `duration` - How much time it will take for the tween to end
* `ease` - The tweening method used, example: `linear`, `circInOut`. Check the link on the note in the first line of this page

noteTweenY.documentation:
Do a tween on a receptor's Y position
* `tag` - Once the tween is finished, it will do a callback of `onTweenCompleted(tag)`
* `note` - Opponent's notes are 0, 1, 2 and 3, respectively. Boyfriend's notes are 4, 5, 6, 7 respectively.
* `value` - Target value on the tween end
* `duration` - How much time it will take for the tween to end
* `ease` - The tweening method used, example: `linear`, `circInOut`. Check the link on the note in the first line of this page

noteTweenAngle.documentation:
Do a tween on a receptor's Angle value
* `tag` - Once the tween is finished, it will do a callback of `onTweenCompleted(tag)`
* `note` - Opponent's notes are 0, 1, 2 and 3, respectively. Boyfriend's notes are 4, 5, 6, 7 respectively.
* `value` - Target value on the tween end
* `duration` - How much time it will take for the tween to end
* `ease` - The tweening method used, example: `linear`, `circInOut`. Check the link on the note in the first line of this page

noteTweenAlpha.documentation:
Do a tween on a receptor's Alpha value
* `tag` - Once the tween is finished, it will do a callback of `onTweenCompleted(tag)`
* `note` - Opponent's notes are 0, 1, 2 and 3, respectively. Boyfriend's notes are 4, 5, 6, 7 respectively.
* `value` - Target value on the tween end
* `duration` - How much time it will take for the tween to end
* `ease` - The tweening method used, example: `linear`, `circInOut`. Check the link on the note in the first line of this page

doTweenX.documentation:
Do a Tween on an object's X value

**Calling this function will cancel another tween that is using the same tag!**
* `tag` - Once the tween is finished, it will do a callback of `onTweenCompleted(tag)`
* `vars` - Variable to tween, example: `boyfriend` for tweening Boyfriend's X position, `boyfriend.scale` for tweening Boyfriend's Scale X
* `value` - Target value on the tween end
* `duration` - How much time it will take for the tween to end
* `ease` - The tweening method used, example: `linear`, `circInOut`. Check the link on the note i've added up here

Example: To do a tween to Boyfriend's Scale X, you should use `doTweenX('bfScaleTweenX', 'boyfriend.scale', 1.5, 1, 'elasticInOut')`, when the tween ends, it will do a callback for `onTweenCompleted('bfScaleTweenX')`

doTweenY.documentation:
Do a Tween on an object's Y value

**Calling this function will cancel another tween that is using the same tag!**
* `tag` - Once the tween is finished, it will do a callback of `onTweenCompleted(tag)`
* `vars` - Variable to tween, example: `boyfriend` for tweening Boyfriend's X position, `boyfriend.scale` for tweening Boyfriend's Scale X
* `value` - Target value on the tween end
* `duration` - How much time it will take for the tween to end
* `ease` - The tweening method used, example: `linear`, `circInOut`. Check the link on the note i've added up here

Example: To do a tween to Boyfriend's Scale X, you should use `doTweenX('bfScaleTweenX', 'boyfriend.scale', 1.5, 1, 'elasticInOut')`, when the tween ends, it will do a callback for `onTweenCompleted('bfScaleTweenX')`

doTweenAngle.documentation:
Do a Tween on an object's Angle value

**Calling this function will cancel another tween that is using the same tag!**
* `tag` - Once the tween is finished, it will do a callback of `onTweenCompleted(tag)`
* `vars` - Variable to tween, example: `boyfriend` for tweening Boyfriend's X position, `boyfriend.scale` for tweening Boyfriend's Scale X
* `value` - Target value on the tween end
* `duration` - How much time it will take for the tween to end
* `ease` - The tweening method used, example: `linear`, `circInOut`. Check the link on the note i've added up here

Example: To do a tween to Boyfriend's Scale X, you should use `doTweenX('bfScaleTweenX', 'boyfriend.scale', 1.5, 1, 'elasticInOut')`, when the tween ends, it will do a callback for `onTweenCompleted('bfScaleTweenX')`

doTweenAlpha.documentation:
Do a Tween on an object's Alpha value

**Calling this function will cancel another tween that is using the same tag!**
* `tag` - Once the tween is finished, it will do a callback of `onTweenCompleted(tag)`
* `vars` - Variable to tween, example: `boyfriend` for tweening Boyfriend's X position, `boyfriend.scale` for tweening Boyfriend's Scale X
* `value` - Target value on the tween end
* `duration` - How much time it will take for the tween to end
* `ease` - The tweening method used, example: `linear`, `circInOut`. Check the link on the note i've added up here

Example: To do a tween to Boyfriend's Scale X, you should use `doTweenX('bfScaleTweenX', 'boyfriend.scale', 1.5, 1, 'elasticInOut')`, when the tween ends, it will do a callback for `onTweenCompleted('bfScaleTweenX')`

doTweenZoom.documentation:
Do a Tween on a Camera's Zoom

**Calling this function will cancel another tween that is using the same tag!**
* `tag` - Once the tween is finished, it will do a callback of `onTweenCompleted(tag)`
* `cam` - Should be `camGame`, `camHUD` or `camOther`
* `value` - Target value on the tween end
* `duration` - How much time it will take for the tween to end
* `ease` - The tweening method used, example: `linear`, `circInOut`. Check the link on the note i've added up here

Example: To do a tween to Boyfriend's Scale X, you should use `doTweenX('bfScaleTweenX', 'boyfriend.scale', 1.5, 1, 'elasticInOut')`, when the tween ends, it will do a callback for `onTweenCompleted('bfScaleTweenX')`

doTweenColor.documentation:
Do a Tween on an object's color

**Calling this function will cancel another tween that is using the same tag!**
* `tag` - Once the tween is finished, it will do a callback of `onTweenCompleted(tag)`
* `vars` - Variable to tween, example: `boyfriend` for tweening Boyfriend's X position, `boyfriend.scale` for tweening Boyfriend's Scale X
* `targetColor` - The color the object will have when the tween ends (Must be in hexadecimal!)
* `duration` - How much time it will take for the tween to end
* `ease` - The tweening method used, example: `linear`, `circInOut`. Check the link on the note i've added up here

Example: To tween Boyfriend's color to Red, you should use `doTweenColor('bfColorTween', 'boyfriend', 'FF0000', 1, 'linear')`, when the tween ends, it will do a callback for `onTweenCompleted('bfColorTween')`

runTimer.documentation:
Runs a timer with a determined duration and loops count.

**Calling this function will cancel another timer that is using the same tag!**
* `tag` - Once the timer is finished, it will do a callback of `onTimerCompleted(tag, loops, loopsLeft)`
* `time` - Optional value, how much time it takes to finish a loop. Default value is `1`
* `loops` - Optional value, how much loops should it do, if it's set to `0`, it will repeat indefinitely. Default value is `1`

cancelTween.documentation: Cancels a tween using the tag `tag`, if there even is one.

cancelTimer.documentation: Cancels a timer using the tag `tag`, if there even is one.

getProperty.documentation:
Returns a current variable from PlayState's name.

It can also be used to get the variable from an object that is inside PlayState or a Lua Sprite.

Example: If you wanted to get the current health's value, you should use `getProperty('health')`.

Example 2: If you'd want to get Boyfriend's current character, you should use `getProperty('boyfriend.curCharacter')`

getPropertyFromGroup.documentation:
Gets a variable from an array/group member on PlayState.
* `obj` - Group/Array variable
* `index` - Member ID
* `variable` - Variable to get the value

Example: To get the next event note's strum Time, you should use `getPropertyFromGroup('eventNotes', 0, 0)`

Example 2: To get the next unspawned note's noteData, you should use `getPropertyFromGroup('unspawnNotes', 0, 'noteData')`

getPropertyFromClass.documentation:
Works similar to `getProperty()`, but can be used to access a variable inside a Class other than PlayState.

Example: To get how much time has passed since the last frame (in milliseconds), you should use `getPropertyFromClass('flixel.FlxG', 'elapsed')`.

setProperty.documentation:
Works in the same way as `getProperty()`, but it sets a new value for the variable.

Also returns the new value of the variable.

Example: To set the player's current health to 100%, you should use `setProperty('health', 2)`

setPropertyFromGroup.documentation:
Sets the new value to a variable from an array/group member on PlayState.
* `obj` - Group/Array variable
* `index` - Member ID
* `variable` - Variable to get the value
* `value` - New value to set

setPropertyFromClass.documentation:
Works similar to `setProperty()`, but can be used to access a variable inside a Class other than PlayState.

Example: To make the mouse visible, you should use `getPropertyFromClass('FlxG', 'mouse.visible', true)`.

openCustomSubstate.documentation: Adds a custom substate named `name` to current FlxState

initLuaShader.documentation: Initializes a new GLSL shader. This will get `name`.frag and `name`.vert files

setSpriteShader.documentation: Sets the shader of some `obj` to `shader`

getShaderBool.documentation: Gets a boolean field from some shader

getShaderBoolArray.documentation: Gets a boolean array field from some shader

getShaderInt.documentation: Gets a integer field from some shader

getShaderIntArray.documentation: Gets a integer array field from some shader

getShaderFloat.documentation: Gets a float field from some shader

getShaderFloatArray.documentation: Gets a float array field from some shader

setShaderBool.documentation: Sets some shader's boolean field to `value`

setShaderBoolArray.documentation: Sets some shader's boolean array field to `value`

setShaderInt.documentation: Sets some shader's integer field to `value`

setShaderIntArray.documentation: Sets some shader's integer array field to `value`

setShaderFloat.documentation: Sets some shader's float field to `value`

setShaderFloatArray.documentation: Sets some shader's float array field to `value`

getRunningScripts.documentation: Returns array of all running lua scripts

callOnLuas.documentation: Calls function on ALL lua scripts

callScript.documentation: Calls a function on specific lua script

getGlobalFromScript.documentation: Gets a global field from specific lua script

setGlobalFromScript.documentation: Sets a global field value from specific lua script to `val`

isRunning.documentation: Checks if specific lua script is running

removeLuaScript.documentation: Removes lua script from active list

runHaxeCode.documentation: Runs a haxe code and returns it's value

addHaxeLibrary.documentation: Adds a haxe library to all hscript scripts

loadSong.documentation: Sets current chart to another song

noteTweenDirection.documentation: Tweens the rotation of `note` for `duration` seconds

setHealth.documentation: Sets player's health ranged from `0` to `1`

addHealth.documentation: Sets player's health ranged from `0` to `1`

getHealth.documentation: Returns player's health ranged from `0` to `1`

keyboardJustPressed.documentation: Checks if specific keyboard key was just pressed

keyboardPressed.documentation: Checks if specific keyboard key is pressed

keyboardReleased.documentation: Checks if specific keyboard key was just released

anyGamepadJustPressed.documentation: Checks if any gamepad specific button was just pressed

anyGamepadPressed.documentation: Checks if any gamepad specific button is pressed

anyGamepadReleased.documentation: Checks if any gamepad specific button was just released

gamepadJustPressed.documentation: Checks if gamepad with id `id` specific button was just pressed

gamepadPressed.documentation: Checks if gamepad with id `id` specific button is pressed

gamepadReleased.documentation: Checks if gamepad with id `id` specific button was just released

exitSong.documentation: Exits current song and goes to Menu

getMidpointX.documentation: Returns the midpoint X of specific FlxSprite hitbox

getMidpointY.documentation: Returns the midpoint Y of specific FlxSprite hitbox

getGraphicMidpointX.documentation: Returns the midpoint X of specific FlxSprite graphic

getGraphicMidpointY.documentation: Returns the midpoint Y of specific FlxSprite graphic

getScreenPositionX.documentation: Returns the X position of `variable` on screen

getScreenPositionY.documentation: Returns the Y position of `variable` on screen

addAnimation.args: obj:String, name:String, frames:Array<Int>, framerate:Int = 24, loop:Bool = true
addAnimation.documentation: Adds a animation to specific sprite

addAnimationByIndicesLoop.documentation: Adds a animation by indices to specific sprite

playAnim.documentation: Plays a animation on specifc sprite

addOffset.documentation: Adds offset to the animation of specific sprite

updateHitboxFromGroup.documentation: Updates the hitbox of item with index `index` in group `group`

luaSpriteExists.documentation: Checks if specific lua sprite exists

luaTextExists.documentation: Checks if specifc lua text object exists

luaSoundExists.documentation: Checks if specific lua sound exists

setHealthBarColors.documentation: Sets the colors player's health bar (in hex)

setTimeBarColors.documentation: Sets the colors of time progress bar (in hex)

getPixelColor.documentation: Gets the color of `obj` specific pixel

setDataFromSave.documentation: Sets the data of specifc save to `value`

getTextFromFile.documentation: Returns content of specific file in text

luaSpriteMakeGraphic.deprecated: luaSpriteMakeGraphic is deprecated! Use makeGraphic instead

luaSpriteAddAnimationByPrefix.args: tag:String, name:String, prefix:String, framerate:Int = 24, loop:Bool = true
luaSpriteAddAnimationByPrefix.deprecated: luaSpriteAddAnimationByPrefix is deprecated! Use addAnimationByPrefix instead

luaSpriteAddAnimationByIndices.deprecated: luaSpriteAddAnimationByIndices is deprecated! Use addAnimationByIndices instead

luaSpritePlayAnimation.deprecated: luaSpritePlayAnimation is deprecated! Use playAnim instead

setLuaSpriteCamera.deprecated: setLuaSpriteCamera is deprecated! Use setObjectCamera instead

setLuaSpriteScrollFactor.deprecated: setLuaSpriteScrollFactor is deprecated! Use setScrollFactor instead

scaleLuaSprite.deprecated: scaleLuaSprite is deprecated! Use scaleObject instead

getPropertyLuaSprite.deprecated: getPropertyLuaSprite is deprecated! Use getProperty instead

setPropertyLuaSprite.deprecated: setPropertyLuaSprite is deprecated! Use setProperty instead

musicFadeIn.documentation: Fades in the volume of music
musicFadeIn.deprecated: musicFadeIn is deprecated! Use soundFadeIn instead.

musicFadeOut.documentation: Fades out the volume of music
musicFadeOut.deprecated: musicFadeOut is deprecated! Use soundFadeOut instead.

stringSplit.documentation: Splits string with `split` delimeter to array of strings

stringTrim.documentation: Removes empty characters from the beginning and end of `string`

setShaderSampler2D.documentation: Sets the shader sampler bitmap to `bitmapdataPath` image

luaDebugMode.documentation: Enables debug mode, use `luaDebugMode = true` to enable it. Default value: `false`

luaDeprecatedWarnings.documentation: Tells you if a function/variable is deprecated (shouldn't be used anymore), only works when Debug mode is on, use `luaDeprecatedWarnings = false` to disable it. Default value: `true`

inChartEditor.documentation: Tells you if your script is running on Chart Editor's chart playtest.

curBpm.documentation: Current BPM of the Song, shortcut to `getPropertyFromClass('Conductor', 'bpm')`

bpm.documentation: Starting BPM of the Song, shortcut to `getProperty('SONG.bpm')`

scrollSpeed.documentation: Starting Scroll speed of the Song, shortcut to `getProperty('SONG.speed')`

difficulty.documentation: Returns the difficulty ID (Easy = 0, Normal = 1, Hard = 2), Shortcut to `getProperty('storyDifficulty')`

weekRaw.documentation: Returns the raw current week number. I doubt you will ever use this, but hey, just in case you do, it's here.

week.documentation: Returns the properly formatted current week file name.

startedCountdown.documentation: Tells you if the countdown already started

seenCutscene.documentation: Is set to `true` after `onCreate()` function, Shortcut to `getProperty('seenCutscene')`

misses.documentation: Current total number of notes missed, Shortcut to `getProperty('songMisses')`

ghostMisses.documentation: Current number of Key press misses, Shortcut to `getProperty('ghostMisses')`

hits.documentation: Current number of notes hit, Shortcut to `getProperty('songHits')`

rating.documentation: Current rating percentage, goes from `0` to `1`. Shortcut to `getProperty('ratingPercent')`

mustHitSection.documentation: Tells if the current section is a `Must Hit Section` (from Chart Editor)

altAnim.documentation: Tells if the current section is a `Alt Animation` Section (from Chart Editor)

gfSection.documentation: Tells if the current section is a `GF Section` (from Chart Editor)

botPlay.documentation: Tells if Botplay is enabled. Shortcut to `getProperty('cpuControlled')`

defaultBoyfriendX.documentation: Player's Default X position, defined by the Stage's JSON file.

defaultBoyfriendY.documentation: Player's Default Y position, defined by the Stage's JSON file.

defaultOpponentX.documentation: Opponent's Default X position, defined by the Stage's JSON file.

defaultOpponentY.documentation: Opponent's Default Y position, defined by the Stage's JSON file.

defaultGirlfriendX.documentation: Girlfriend's Default X position, defined by the Stage's JSON file.

defaultGirlfriendY.documentation: Girlfriend's Default Y position, defined by the Stage's JSON file.

ghostTapping.documentation: Ghost tapping is enabled. Shortcut to `getPropertyFromClass('ClientPrefs', 'ghostTapping')`

hideTime.documentation: "Hide Song Length" is enabled. Shortcut to `getPropertyFromClass('ClientPrefs', 'hideTime')`

noteOffset.documentation: Represents the note delay in milliseconds (Goes from `0` to `500`). Shortcut to `getPropertyFromClass('ClientPrefs', 'noteOffset')`

curStage.documentation: Returns the id/name of current stage

difficultyPath.documentation: Returns path of current song chart

curDecBeat.documentation: Returns current beat in a decimal (float) value

curDecStep.documentation: Returns current step in a decimal (float) value

practice.documentation: Whatever or not practice mode is on

defaultPlayerStrumX.documentation: Returns default X position of player strumline

defaultPlayerStrumY.documentation: Returns default Y position of player strumline

defaultOpponentStrumX.documentation: Returns default X position of opponents strumline

defaultOpponentStrumY.documentation: Returns default Y position of opponents strumline

boyfriendName.documentation: First name BOYFRIEND last name .xml (but seriously it's current character name of boyfriend)

scoreZoom.documentation: Returns whatever or not score bar should be zoomed when a note is hit

healthBarAlpha.documentation: Current alpha value of health bar

noResetButton.documentation: If true reset button does nothing

shadersEnabled.documentation: Whetever or not shaders are enabled by player

currentModDirectory.documentation: Returns the path to current mod

buildTarget.documentation: The build target, should be `windows`, `linux`, `mac`, `browser`, `android` or `unknown` (useful to block playing a mod on gamaverse)

onCreate.documentation: Local function called after registering all lua functions/variables

onCreatePost.documentation: Local function called after registering every main function/variables

onDestroy.documentation: Local function called when this script gets released from the memory

onTweenCompleted.documentation: Local function called after specific `tag` tween is completed

onTimerCompleted.documentation: Local function called everytime `tag` timer loops/completes

onSoundFinished.documentation: Local function called after specific sound with `tag` tag finishes

onCustomSubstateCreate.documentation: Local function called when custom substate is created

onCustomSubstateCreatePost.documentation: Local function called after custom substate `create()` function gets called

onCustomSubstateUpdate.documentation: Local function called when custom substate updates

onCustomSubstateUpdatePost.documentation: Local function called after custom substate `update()` function gets called

onCustomSubstateDestroy.documentation: Local function called after custom substate gets destroyed

onGameOverStart.documentation: Local function called when gameover screen is created

onUpdate.documentation: Local function called when playstate/gameover screen is updated

onGameOverConfirm.documentation: Local function called when player presses [[Confirm]] to restart current playstate or go back to menu

onUpdatePost.documentation: Local function called when playstate/gameover screen `update()` function is called

onStartCountdown.documentation: Local function called when countdown is started

onCountdownStarted.documentation: Local function called when after countdown

onCountdownTick.documentation: Local function called every countdown tick

onUpdateScore.documentation: Local function called when score text gets updated

onNextDialogue.documentation: Local function called when dialogue goes to another page

onSkipDialogue.documentation: Local function called when dialogue is skipped

onSongStart.documentation: Local function called when song starts

eventEarlyTrigger.documentation: Local function called before event note triggers, must return the miliseconds event delay

onResume.documentation: Local function called after game resumes

onPause.documentation: Local function called after game pauses

onSpawnNote.documentation: Local function called when game note is spawned

onGameOver.documentation: Local function called when player fucking dies

onEvent.documentation: Local function called when some event gets triggered

onMoveCamera.documentation: Local function called when camera focuses on specific character, characters: `gf`, `dad`, `boyfriend`

onEndSong.documentation: Local function called when song ends

onGhostTap.documentation: Local function called when player ghost taps

onKeyPress.documentation: Local function called when player presses some key

onKeyRelease.documentation: Local function called when player releases some key

noteMiss.documentation: Local function called when player misses a note, (`badNoteHit()`?)

noteMissPress.documentation: Local function called when player misses

opponentNoteHit.documentation: Local function called when opponent hits a note

goodNoteHit.documentation: Local function called when player hits a note

onStepHit.documentation: Local function called every song step

onBeatHit.documentation: Local function called every song beat

onSectionHit.documentation: Local function called when jumping to another section

onRecalculateRating.documentation: Local function called accuracy percent is recalculated/updates
